reviews.sentence: Modern relatively clean relatively quiet dog friendly nice staff. We stayed here for the first time for one night with two small dogs on Wednesday. We were looking for a dog friendly hotel just north of Jacksonville and found this place listed on bringfidocom. We read all the reviews along with several on tripadvisor before booking. Our usual routine. Aside from 1 review we only review lodging. Pulling up were were pleased with the modern look. The location was good. Relatively easy to find using our gps. Lots of options nearby for dining shopping fuel. The parking lot was empty out back aside from 2 vehicles so we parked there and were able to walk next door to Outback Steakhouse for dinner. Our room was not on the top floor nor the end as requested. We are very light sleepers. The room was small and had a sleek sparse feel but good for travelers and particularly those needing only a nights stay. The lobby and lobby bar were very cool looking but we did not get to try it as the menu was very limited so we walked next door. There is a lounge fireplace that you can also see and feel in the modern seating area next to the pool. Smokers were utilizing it occasionally as they hotel is smoke free thank goodness. Music was being pumped out there too. There were plenty of grassy area for walking the pups and the landscaping out back and near the pool area was very cool. More about the room yes small but the king size bed was comfy. However the pillows looked cool as they were nice and long but the linens were very scratchy and the pillows turned out to not be comfy leaving both my husband and I with headaches the next am Also around 245 am a heavy footed stomper started making noise on the floor above us. They continued the rest of the night and I laid there with earplugs and our ocean sleep track playing until we finally got up in the morning. People can be so rude. We never heard any other dogs. The bathroom was interesting and sort of cool. There is a light wall with a frosted glass panel that emits or received light from the bedroom. The shower and toilet area can be closed off with a giant mirrored door which gives privacy to those showering and a awesome mirror to those dressing or putting on makeup. One corner of the shower had black mildew running down the seam. Also because its only a shower no tub or spigot turning on the water is interesting. In order to not get wet you have to first take your hand and turn the shower head into the wall away from you then turn the water on all the way so it gets hot. You will get a little wet but not as much if you do not turn the shower head away. Other than the mildew and shower head placement its a big open modern shower. I like it that they place shampoo and body wash in the dispensers. less waste and better for the environment in bulk. OH. if you stay more than one night and do not use housekeeping they give you 5 to use at the bar or extra stay points. cool. Other than that the only bad thing was the coffee prep station was not very clean. I hesitated to use the coffee maker. There was a stir stick left by someone too. The plastic on the cups was torn and there was soap smeared on them. We did not watch any tv because we were tired from the drive but it was a nice big tv easily viewable from the bed. The bed lighting was muted enough for reading but not glaring. It was sort of romantic. The window blinds were great for keeping out the morning sun andor parking lot lights at night. I would give this place a try again. However I want to know why we could not have received an end room or a top floor room to help with noise. Maybe checking in at 7 pm on a Wednesday is too late to get requests. Some places only place dogs on certain floors but that should be stated on the website. It is about 2 hours from here to Savannah. A straight shot pretty much. Hope this review helps you out.

Great hotel for pre or post flights. This was our second stay at ALOFT. It was a pre flight stay. We like it because it is a great location for air travel. The hotel is very clean modern. The rooms are well organized and well equipted. Beds are very comfortable. Convenient to airport and restaurants. Comfortable beds. Near airport restaurants and huge shopping area. Just off I95 Prefer having a bathtub and shower.

Great hotel 1010 would stay again. I had a wonderful stay the room was modern and very clean good for a quick getaway. In the middle of the shopping center is the perfect location. Not much night life around but they got a bar that stays open till midnight which was great. 1010 would stay again.
Great Hotel. We will stay here again. Hotel was clean and super friendly staff. Restaurants and shopping right by hotel.
Good atmosphere. Surrounded by a ton of shops and restaurants. Near the airport as well.

Hurricane Matthew Stay. We were here during Hurricane Matthew and the staff were great. The were acomating to all including pets. Hard working and pleasant throughout stay. Thanks for keeping us safe.

location and comfort. rooms were very comfortable neat clean very handy to have bar on premesis. location. it fit very well into our plans. overall appearance condition great. see above. Carabas next door nothing I found.
Bed was very comfortable and room was a nice size too though a bit beat up scruff marks on headboard wall paper peeling etc. Airport shuttle was great.

Pictures are misleading. The beds were nice and comfortable. Rooms were clean. They gave us an extra 20 minutes past dusk to swim. The shower leaked all over the floor. The soaps from the room left a weird film on my skin. Pool area could use an upgrade.
Staff was very hospitable and the sales director Mauren was a pleasure to work with.

We booked room while we were planning our route away from Florida due threath of hurricane Irma. We did change our plans and were not able to stay in Aloft Hotel. We booked low price no money back room. Anyway we canceled and got all money back. Thank you so much Aloft Jacksonville.

Jacksonville Beach. I stayed there for a weekend getaway. Nice establishment. Clean professional beautiful decor. The ladies at the front desk are exceptionally polite. I was allowed to check in early and received a room upgrade. Looking forward to returning soon.

Head board was all scratched phone did not work in room shade was not operational when asked to move to another room the front desk clerk hesitated about moving to another room in this room the overhead lights over the bed did not work. Front desk clerk did not notify shuttle driver that I was waiting at the airport after waiting 12 hour. I Called again and when the driver arrived he said he was never given the original request. The outside building was well maintained Great shopping nearby Rooms need to be cleaned better replace headboard that are peeling.
We only stayed for one night so it served our purpose. I thought the outside of the building was really great and close to a lot of stuff. It ’s felt as everything was cheaply remodeled.

When the dumb ass employee burns her toast at 6 am and sets off the fire alarm. The entire hotel was woken up and had evacuated to due the stupidly of this freaking employee. And the front desk person did n’t even give a dam that she woke everyone up. Oh I ’m sorry it was a simple mistake. Really. You set off the fire alarm because you could n’t even watch your toast. I mean WTF. Now for my room. The toilet kept running 247 the shower leaked all over the floor becausetheir was no weather stripping. the bed and pillows are the worst ever. The desk had water damage and was all warped the bed headboard and walls were covered in scratchesHas a SPG Platinum member this is the worst hotel that I have ever stayed in. Absolutely horrible.

To even begin with I had the expectations of a nice hotel because of how the one in our hometown has been talked about. Upon arrival at the hotel the girl whom checked us in was a little courteous but very short and not welcoming. We get room 317 at first and head up to that. Open the door to disgusting carpet a room that smelt as if it had just been smoked in and a scratched up headboard that was flaking off on to the pillows. I moved the blanket back to find a hair on the sheets and it looked as it the top blankets were just straightened up to look as if the room had been taken care of. We checked in so late due to being at a wedding hence our reasoning of needing this room that we really did not feel like walking down to the lobby to try to get another room. When I went into the bathroom area where the shower and toilet are located it had a used bar of soap in it and at that point I decided we needed to change rooms contemplated hotels completely. Calling the front desk she stated she would send room service to my room to clean it I told her nicely that we wanted to be moved because we were exhausted and did not feel like waiting around for them to complete it. After being on hold for about 4 minutes she switches us to room 517 we walked in and it reached of bleach to the point that it was nauseating. It was a little bit cleaner but there was still a scratched and peeling headboard random long scratch marks all over the wells and gross tiles that needed to be scrubbed badly in the bathroom. We got to the point of just staying to sleep and as soon as we could get up to do our drive we would leave. Upon checking out our welcome bag from our wedding was not in the room and the girl I asked for it was annoyed that I asked if I could please have it. Because of this ONE experience at this hotel we will NOT EVER stay at another ALoft or Starwod Hotel. It is hard enough to travel but it is even harder when you feel like you are sleeping in other peoples filth because people do not want to clean it up.
Love the layout of the rooms. Customer service was good when I went. Lots of options around the hotel when it comes to dining.
They are pet friendly but it is kinda going downhill.

Firstly the location was very convenient. Easy walking to almost anything you need for a trip or food. Staff was very friendly from the second I stepped in there. If I had any issues my key card did not work suddenly they immediately apologized and quickly fixed it. They never acted like I was bothering them. They also have a van to drive you to nearby locations and pick you up complimentary. I did not need to utilize this but was nice to know it was available. Beds were comfortable. Lots of pillows which I loved. TV was glitchy but not an issue that would interfere with my comfort. They only offer complimentary coffee or tea in the morning. You will need to purchase breakfast if you want it. They are up front about it so again does not hurt my rating. I most definitely stay in this hotel again.
Nice clean hotel near everything. Staff was helpful. I just wish they had free cookies breakfast or aomething.

Different. This hotel is a bit different that is for sure. I m not sure contemporary is the word. My room with a king size bed seemed small compared to other hotels I have stayed at. But bed is comfy. Just a small desk and chair is the only other furniture. Definitely different.

Excellent property that will be amazing once the remodeling is complete. The staff was great and treated our whole family including our pet like special guests. The remodeling is gorgeous. a big improvement over the way the property looked when we last stayed there in August. We had a newly renovated room on the fifth floor. The breakfast was not good. The service was slow and the food unappealing. I would not go with the breakfast plan in the future. Also please consider putting extra blankets in the rooms during the winter months. It was cold last night and I woke up in the middle of the night freezing with no extra blanket in the room. Thanks.

Euro style hotel. Cleanliness was ok appeared to be a fairly new facility. Small rooms slow elevators no breakfast buffet. did not like walking into bathroom when I opened entry door. Pocket door on toilet area not good for kids. OK for a single night stay. Good location near airport. Staff was helpful and friendly.

You can never go wrong with Aloft. Aloft hotels are absolutely perfect in my opinion. Clean fantastic bathroom the shower great layout in room luxury sheets lots of desk space all built in. The decor is modern and very calming. The service at this hotel was phenomenal. The front desk was very friendly professional smart helpful. The shuttle driver whose name I can not remember unfortunately worked weekdays was an absolutely gentleman. He drove my daughter I to many nearby places during our two days at Aloft. Thank you all for a great stay. I will never stay anywhere else if Aloft is an option where I am traveling.

WXYZ Bar. The girls at the bar Megan and Heather were on point. Personality and knowledge of mixed drinks was what kept me spending money in this bar. Even came with magic tricks to keep the customers entertained. Had a few hiccups with the room and the hotel itself but nothing that was major and nothing that was not fixed immediately. Best experience at a hotel thus far.

No king bed for us. Disappointing Reward Travel. So disappointed. We love Aloft properties. We arrived at noon yesterday knowing that we were too early to check in but I asked. I was told no that they were too busy and that they had so many late check outs plus it was noon and housekeeping had just started to clean rooms. I understood however I wanted the front desk person to understand that we were going to need to now check in late about midnight. She noted our reservation. When we returned at 130pm we checked in went to our room and was surprised that it was not a king size bed. instead it was a double. I called the front dest person explained that I informed the previous front desk person that we would be checking in late and hoping that we would have the room we booked. She said that yes our reservation was noted. We were disappointed. The front desk person said she could give us a voucher for breakfast. That is what she could offer. Love the property and not impressed with the personnel. I wanted to speak with the front desk person this morning but she was on the phone and I got tired of waiting for her. I stood there for a little bit and then left. Would not suggest people stay at this property. This was not a very good reward bummer.

Aloft is nice BUT do nt check in late. We booked for a king room ended up with a room with 2 double queen beds was told they over booked for a room with king beds. The lady at check in was more personable the other gentleman seemed like he was doing us a big face by checking us in True we did nt check in until after 10 pm but We were expecting a king bed. Room was nice and clean but front desk could use a little more personality and he never mention that he was giving us a room with 2 beds instead of a king. We did not find out until we got to the room that it was not king. I guess the moral of this story is either do nt check in late or you may not get what you were expecting. Will see in the Morning how the rest of the stay goes. Good Luck on your bookings.

I would stay here again. Met my needs. Unusual floor plan set up like a city loft. Efficient use of space. Comfortable room and bed. Clean and good amenities. Because of the open floor plan we did not have a lot privacy. Traveling with family i did not want to undress in front of ao I had to go into the shower area. Pocket did not close well but we made do.

Modern hotel across from huge shopping area with tons of restaurants fast food places and stores to chose from Walmart included. The shuttle is a wonderful perk and when not making airport drop offs or pick ups their priority. they are willing to drop you to most restaurants in the area which are at most a 15 minute walk.

Aloft first time. I ’ve seen some of the negative reviews. I really think most of those bad experiences are rarities and not the norm at Aloft. I traveled for work for 25 years. I spent a lot of time in different chain ’s over the years. Once in awhile you run into a bad night. Usually you can get it addressed pretty quickly. There are exceptions but you can find that in any business. I just spent 4 nights in Aloft. 2 nights in Jacksonville Airport and 2 nights in the other Jacksonville location. I must say I was very pleased with everything about our stay. We have been members of the Mariot rewards program for years and love their hotels. What attracted us to this brand was how pet friendly they are. Pets stay for free and they treat them as part of the family. Traveling with a pet can be difficult and expensive. Some Mariot properties charge as 750 to 200 per night. It ’s always been my least favorite thing about Mariot properties before Aloft. I would suggest that the Mariot properties that are not in the premium category get more in line with the pricing in the industry. I see 250 a night as a reasonable price for a pet without damage to the room. Keep up the good work Aloft. We ’l be backPete Cape Cod.
